intro: Dicladanthera glabra, commonly known as the smooth dicladanthera, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually smooth and lance-shaped. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Dicladanthera glabra is often found in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
